column4: must I compile "firmware" into a new kernel for a single user desktop system?
firmware is sometimes used in wifi and maybe other things,  do you use wifi in this desktop system?
10x.  No, I don't use wifi.. It is a wired connection
would I need firmware compiled if I plan on installing radeon proprietary drivers?
well it takes not much space or time to compile so I think I would keep it in the event you test a usb wifi dongle with it some day
what would it hurt if you did compile the firmware?
dunno..
I guess worst case you can delete the firmware files after you compile if it breaks something
I guess I just want it as lean as possible
I see.  Thanks for your time
and for me it takes hours to compile so I turn lots of stuf on so I don't have to do it again
Let me ask you one more question.  What is your media player of preference?
hours to compile?  Do you have a single processor system?
totem seems to come up as default so that's what I normaly use
no it's dual core but old
maybe I count the time it takes to download the source also
ouch
put it this way it takes long enuf for me to leave so I"m not sure how long it takes
I remember those days.  I would download the ubuntu iso with dialup.. I took 25 hours!  Now w/comcast about 20mins
even at 20 mins I'm not going to sit there waiting for it
